CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 28, 1964, pg. 3 reads: "Health-O-Rama Planning - Hospital personnel from Magee and Mercy Hospitals are busy making final plans for the forthcoming Health-O-Rama to be held at the Savoy Ballroom, 2009 Centre Ave., Pittsburgh 19, Pa., April 9,10,11 and 12. Now in its fifth year, Health-O-Rama is sponsored by the United Fund's Health Research and Services Foundation in cooperation with the Allegheny County Health Department.  Area residents will be offered free screening tests for diabetes, anemia, vision, hearing, height, and weight and a chest X-ray for the detection of lung cancer, enlarged heart and tuberculosis.  Shown above are laboratory technicians from Mercy Hospital, seated left to right: Roberta Klimaski, Mickey Reynolds, Sister Edwin and Jocelyn Cage; standing from left to right: Elaine Linkhauer, Janet Doerr, Diane DeSimone, Ben Brown, Lonnie Touchstone, Rebecca Vantine, John Humphrey and J. Kelley.  They will also be assisted by technicians from Magee, other local hospitals and private clinics. - Harris photo."
TitMainTitle: Mercy Hospital laboratory technicians, from left, seated: Roberta Klimaski, Mickey Reynolds, Sister Edwin, Jocelyn Cage; standing: Elaine Linkhauer, Janet Doerr, Diane DeSimone, Ben Brown, Lonnie Touchstone, Rebecca Vantine, John Humphrey, and J. Kelley, in laboratory with virgin Mary figurine over doorway, possibly Mercy Hospital, another version
